resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

pitrou commented on pull request #5948: ARROW-7303: [C++] Refactor CSV benchmarks to use Result APIs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5948#discussion_r353477830
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/csv/converter_benchmark.cc
 ##########
 @@ -79,8 +79,7 @@ static void BenchmarkConversion(benchmark::State& state,  // NOLINT non-const re
   std::shared_ptr<Converter> converter = *Converter::Make(type, options);
 
   while (state.KeepRunning()) {
-    std::shared_ptr<Array> result;
-    ABORT_NOT_OK(converter->Convert(parser, 0 /* col_index */, &result));
+    ASSIGN_OR_ABORT(auto result, converter->Convert(parser, 0 /* col_index */));
 
 Review comment:
   Why not simply `auto result = *converter->Convert(parser, 0 /* col_index */);`?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: [C++] Refactor benchmarks to use new Result APIs

comments.body: We don't build the benchmarks indeed. I think a daily cron GHA job would be suitable, at least to exercise them.
